data.text: @_mbdr_ Man who could have thought this would happen. People would say "it's only 7 deaths". 7 deaths per million and those are the ones we know of from the little testing and tracing we do. The excess/undetected covid deaths are probably through the roof right now.
@Joewyatt75 @stephafogarty @_mbdr_ I don't believe that for one second.
@Joewyatt75 @FredoLives @stephafogarty @_mbdr_ How does that report has to do anything with your point?
@FredoLives @stephafogarty @_mbdr_ I have a copy of the Pfizer report I can send you if you are genuinely interested ?
@Joewyatt75 @_mbdr_ Mainly because they are old and sick. They are not dying of covid. But old people die of age.
@_mbdr_ Why not classify "from" by looking at suspected cause and making the cutoff much longer (18 months) and at least remove obvious misclassifications like car accidents?

@_mbdr_ Found more here: https://t.co/wAFwXjWESG The way they record Covid death in order to be near real-time is strange. They will incorrectly classify death as Covid when it's not and by cutting off at 30 days, will miss death where Covid may have been the underlying cause.
